meanings.definition: Used to express mild surprise or acknowledgment of a mistake.
meanings.sent2: Oh no, oops, I spilled some water on the table.
meanings.sent3: Oops, I accidentally put salt instead of sugar in my coffee!
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character's oops moment added a touch of humor to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The loud oops from the audience indicated a collective realization of the mistake.

meanings.definition: An exclamation uttered when something goes wrong or a mistake is made.
meanings.sent1: Oops! I tripped on the step.
meanings.sent2: She exclaimed 'oops' when she realized she sent the email to the wrong person.
meanings.sent3: The chef's 'oops' as he dropped the cake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic's 'oops' echoed in the garage as he accidentally dropped a tool.
meanings.sent5: The child's loud 'oops' drew attention to the broken vase.
